intro: Tephrosia aurantiaca var. longifolia, commonly known as the orange tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or orange flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
